alert.note: Alert for Day; Grant; Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 02 at 1:29AM MDT until April 06 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Marshall, Roberts, Day and Grant Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CDT today. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For this blizzard watch...for many locations this has the potential to be the worst storm of the season. This two day long storm system will result in dangerous or impossible driving conditions, which could place stranded motorists in potentially life threatening circumstances.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
